page.title: 19In and around Creeting
page.content: Creeting is an pleasant place to drive through, and there are several footpaths both through fields and along the river. There is also a nature reserve called Fen Alder Carr. Buildings worth seeing are Hawks Mill, an old water mill, not used any more but attractive to look at. The two churches at Creeting St. Mary and St. Peter are worth a visit.The former stands in a very commanding position above the road. There are some interesting old houses at the centre of Creeting St. Mary.Two adjoining houses, one white and one pink, were the King's Head Inn until 1959 and were originally built as a farmhouse in 1580. Opposite is a cottage, half-flint, originally two labourers' cottages, later a forge, then a wheel- wright's. Another cottage was lived in by a stockman, then was a post office.
